input_text:
Job Title: Compliance Benefits Analyst (Non-Discrimination Testing)

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Analyst, Consulting, Customer Service

Description:
Step into a rewarding career and be a part of an innovative team that is changing the face of the employee benefits industry - with CXC Solutions (CXC)! 
Vision: To be the industry benchmark in building and delivering health benefits management solutions
Mission: To eliminate inefficiencies across the healthcare value chain and thereby contribute to the reduction of healthcare costs in the United States
Core Values:• Relationships: Build long-term, trusted, and valuable relationships with our clients, our people, and our partners• Innovation: Create maximum business value for our clients by implementing creative solutions• Leadership: Focus, inspire, motivate, and grow our clients and ourselves to achieve exceptional results• Openness: Be open, honest, and direct to build trust with our clients and amongst each other

Position: Compliance Benefits Analyst (Non-Discrimination Testing)
Job Duties and Responsibilities: Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with a disability to perform essential functions.
• Facilitates a critical communications role by interacting with clients, subject matter experts, project team members and development personnel.• Ability to work with multiple spreadsheets and sources of data to accurately and efficiently integrate into one data file and ability to identify issues based on analysis of this data.• Ensures the timely and successful delivery of solutions according to client needs and objectives.• Research regulations by reviewing regulatory bulletins and other sources of information.• Becomes the subject matter expert on compliance solutions and tools.• Gathers, interprets, and translates customer needs into functional and non-functional requirements.• Understands system behavior, inputs, and outputs as they relate to business functions.• Helps confirm that new releases function as intended and there is no negative impact to existing functionality.
Skills and Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s degree required, or equivalent years of professional work experience that demonstrates the ability to perform the duties of the position.• 3+ years of project analysis or other relevant experience, with client facing exposure.• 3+ years of experience with Non-Discrimination Testing focusing on Health and Welfare benefits.• Strong hands-on knowledge of Health and Welfare benefits and products.• Ability to research regulations by reviewing regulatory bulletins and other sources of information.• Strong verbal and written communication skills• Intermediate knowledge of Excel (V-look ups, pivot tables, text to column) and Project Management tools• Proven ability to manage multiple projects at a time while paying strict attention to detail.• Proven ability to document and troubleshoot technical solutions.• Strong customer service focus, work ethic, and attention to detail are critical to success in this position.• Ability to summarize and communicate complex ideas and review them with key project stakeholders at multiple levels of the organization.• Strong Listening, project management, analytical, and presentation skills, ideally within the health benefits or technical industries.• Ability to learn and be proficient in CXC Solutions proprietary programs.
Supervisory Responsibility:
This position has no direct supervisory responsibilities.
Work Environment:
This position has the option to be fully remote, or work in a hybrid model that consists of both remote and in-office. Our office is in Dallas, Texas. The position reports directly to the Director of Compliance Delivery Services. This job operates in a professional office environment, whether in person or remotely.
Expected Hours of Work:
Monday through Friday, 40 hours a week, following an agreed-upon schedule.
Travel:
Minimal travel is required.
Other Duties:
Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

CXC Solutions, LLC. is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
